comments:
I was using eclipse 3.1.1, need to do some performance profiling of one of my apps, so decided to give TPTP a try.
I following the install instructions (EMF 2.1, agent, then TPTP 4.1)

Got errors, so did full update (eclipse 3.1.2, and TPTP4.1.0.1).

Still getting errors, and cannot use at all. When I follow the Getting Started guide (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/tutorials/profilingtool/profilingexample_32.html), I get to section 3.2, and get error dialogs at steps 2 and 3.  This causes me to not be able to create a launch config for the app I wish to profile.

Below are the two errors in the log. Bug report too long if also attach full config (JDK1.5.0_06).

Thanks,
Kev (need to profile today, so off to find another profiler...)

===============================

Created an attachment (id=34666)
Eclipse configuration details

According to the Requirement of TPTP 4.1.0.1.

#  Java runtime (JRE) or Java development kit (JDK) 1.4
# Eclipse SDK 3.1.2
# Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF) SDK 2.1.2
# XML Schema Infoset Model (XSD) SDK 2.1.2 

are required, and it seems like you are having EMF and XSD 2.1.0 in your configuration, can you try update their level and try again.

OK - sorry.  I thought I had hit update in all the right boxes but it seems not. I thought maybe part of the problem was that I only had the runtime, not the sdk of these?  EMF runtime updated, and I installed the latest XSD runtime zip but that didn't help. After an hour of trying I gave up and downloaded the combined EMF XSD 2.1.2 SDK zip, but even that doesn't seem to have fixed it.  
However, the version numbers for XSD are still listed as 2.1.1, not 2.1.2.

Any other suggestions?
please try a fresh Eclipse workbench and load/import you old workspace to see if it helps.
Hubert, can you please follow up on this

From your eclipse configuration log, I see you are using Sun JDK 1.5. This version of TPTP was developed and tested using JDK 1.4.2.  Java 5 is not supported.  Can you try to use Java 1.4.2 and see if the problem goes away?  Thanks.
Kev, Please reopen the bug and assign to me if you still experience problems after changing Java JDK to 1.4.2.  Thanks.
